results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley
results.title: Alec Baldwin Will Be Charged With Involuntary Manslaughter in ‘Rust’ Killing
results.abstract: A gun that Mr. Baldwin was rehearsing with went off, killing the film’s cinematographer. The armorer responsible for weapons on set also faces manslaughter charges.

results.adx_keywords: School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Firearms;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Gun Control;Zwerner, Abigail;Richneck Elementary School (Newport News, Va);Newport News (Va);Virginia
results.byline: By Sarah Mervosh and Campbell Robertson
results.title: 6-Year-Old Accused of Shooting Teacher in Virginia Has ‘Acute Disability,’ Family Says
results.abstract: The child had previously been accompanied by a parent every day in school, but that stopped the week of the shooting, his family said.

media.caption: People gathered for a vigil for Abigail Zwerner, the first-grade teacher who was shot at Richneck Elementary School.

results.adx_keywords: Mental Health and Disorders;Hypothermia;Black People;Deaths (Fatalities);Bouchard, Michael J;Detroit (Mich);Pontiac (Mich);Oakland County (Mich)
results.title: Michigan Woman and 2 Sons Freeze to Death After Days on the Street
results.abstract: The sheriff of Oakland County, who noted that a 10-year-old daughter had survived, called the deaths preventable, citing the mother’s untreated mental illness.

media.caption: “We don’t give our mental health providers and systems enough support,” Sheriff Michael Bouchard of Oakland County said during a news conference in Pontiac, Mich., on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Refugees and Displaced Persons;Nonprofit Organizations;RefugePoint;International Rescue Committee
results.title: Biden Administration Invites Ordinary Americans to Help Settle Refugees
results.abstract: The program to speed up refugee arrivals will allow private citizens to sponsor families in their communities after raising funds and undergoing training.

media.caption: Afghan refugees fleeing the Taliban takeover of their country on the tarmac of the military side of Kabul International Airport in 2021. The private sponsorship initiative will incorporate lessons learned from the emergency responses to the Afghan crisis.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Politics and Government;Elections;Vaccination and Immunization;Women and Girls;Christchurch, New Zealand, Attack (March 2019);Conspiracy Theories;Ardern, Jacinda;New Zealand
results.title: How Covid’s Bitter Divisions Tarnished a Liberal Icon
results.abstract: In a part of the world where coronavirus restrictions lingered, Jacinda Ardern struggled to get beyond her association with pandemic policy.

media.caption: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern of New Zealand last year. She won global fame with youthful charisma and a frank, compassionate leadership style that carried her through crisis but has since announced her resignation.

results.adx_keywords: Alcohol Abuse;Research;Alcoholic Beverages;Wines;Labeling and Labels (Product);Canada
results.title: Canada’s New Guidelines for Alcohol Say ‘No Amount’ Is Healthy
results.abstract: The guidance builds on growing evidence, after decades of sometimes conflicting research, that even small amounts of alcohol can have serious health consequences.

media.caption: Drinking even small amounts of alcohol “is damaging to everyone, regardless of age, sex, gender, ethnicity, tolerance for alcohol or lifestyle,” the Canadian Centre on Substance Use and Addiction said in a report.
media.copyright: Jen Osborne for The New York Times

results.title: Why the U.S. Is Sending More Powerful Weapons to Ukraine
results.abstract: Efforts to arm Kyiv have stepped up in the past few weeks as the war enters a critical phase.

results.adx_keywords: Football;Super Bowl;Fans (Persons);Allen, Josh (1996- );Hamlin, Damar (1998- );Kelly, Jim (1960- );Buffalo Bills;National Football League;Buffalo (NY)
results.title: Parenting Lessons From the 1990s Kids Who Grew Up Bills Fans
results.abstract: They said watching the Bills lose four straight Super Bowls taught them about football and life. The Times asked which of those lessons of fandom were worth passing on to their children now that the team is favored to win it all.

media.copyright: Joshua Bessex for The New York Times

results.byline: By Maria Cramer, Hurubie Meko and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: 24 Indicted in $5 Million Construction Kickback and Bribery Scheme
results.abstract: The suspects, who were arrested in a predawn roundup, are accused of skimming money during the construction of luxury buildings and boutique hotels.

media.caption: The accused men were brought to the First Precinct in Manhattan early Wednesday morning.

results.adx_keywords: Appointments and Executive Changes;Ardern, Jacinda;New Zealand
results.title: Jacinda Ardern, New Zealand’s Leader, Says She Will Step Down
results.abstract: Ms. Ardern, a global liberal icon who has faced rising political headwinds at home, will leave office by Feb. 7, she said.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Frauds and Swindling;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Eastman, John C;Trump, Donald J;Pence, Mike;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.byline: By Danny Hakim and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: John Eastman Is Unbowed as Investigations Proliferate
results.abstract: A legal reckoning awaits a chief architect of Donald Trump’s effort to reverse his election loss. But in Mr. Eastman’s telling, he was far from a criminal.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: John C. Eastman, onscreen, during a hearing by the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol.

results.adx_keywords: Philanthropy;Shopping and Retail;E-Commerce;Computers and the Internet;Bezos, Jeffrey P;Gaetz, Matt;Amazon.com Inc
results.title: Amazon Axes ‘Smile’ Charity Program, Citing Limited Impact
results.abstract: The move comes as Amazon is laying off 18,000 workers, but a company spokesman said the decision to end the AmazonSmile program was not a cost-cutting measure.

media.caption: AmazonSmile has distributed about half a billion dollars in donations since 2013, the company said.

results.adx_keywords: Rescues;Missing Persons;Hikes and Hiking;Actors and Actresses;Rain;Sands, Julian;Gregory, Robert (1961- );San Gabriel Mountains;Crystal Lake (Calif);California
results.byline: By Derrick Bryson Taylor and Johnny Diaz
results.title: Julian Sands Is Reported Missing on Mountain Hike in California
results.abstract: The search for Mr. Sands, a British actor known for the 1986 film “A Room With a View” and other roles, is an avid trail hiker. His disappearance follows weeks of devastating weather across California.

media.caption: The actor Julian Sands in 2013, in Beverly Hills, Calif.

results.adx_keywords: Habits and Routines (Behavior);Alcoholic Beverages;Alcohol Abuse;New Year;Cocktails and Mixed Drinks
results.title: Drinking Again? Maybe the Problem Is Dry January.
results.abstract: The annual sobriety challenge is more popular than ever, but like many New Year’s resolutions, it can end early in failure. But there are still benefits to trying, experts say.

media.caption: Alcohol-free beverages in Hilary Sheinbaum’s home in Manhattan. Ms. Sheinbaum is on her seventh Dry January and has chronicled her efforts in a book, “The Dry Challenge.”
media.copyright: Hilary Swift for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Homeless Persons;Social Media;Assaults;Jenkins, Brooke (District Attorney);Police Department (San Francisco, Calif);San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: San Francisco Gallery Owner Is Charged After Spraying Homeless Woman
results.abstract: Shannon Collier Gwin, 71, was charged with misdemeanor battery after a bystander’s video that was widely shared online showed him spraying a woman with a hose outside his business.

media.caption: Shannon Collier Gwin, 71, spraying a homeless woman on the sidewalk outside his art gallery in San Francisco’s Financial District, in a video that circulated widely on social media.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Child Abuse and Neglect;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Haight, Michael (d 2023);Enoch City (Utah);Utah
results.title: Utah Man Who Killed His Family Faced Child Abuse Investigation in 2020
results.abstract: The man, who committed suicide after fatally shooting seven family members, had been violent toward his eldest daughter, she told the police at the time. But no charges were filed because of a lack of evidence, prosecutors said.

media.caption: A 2020 incident report from the Enoch City Police Department indicated that Michael Haight had been investigated over an allegation that he was violent with his daughter. He later shot and killed his family.
media.copyright: Rick Egan/The Salt Lake Tribune, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Pop and Rock Music;Music;Drug Abuse and Traffic;Nineteen Hundred Sixties;Crosby, David;CROSBY, STILLS, NASH & YOUNG;Byrds, The
results.title: David Crosby, Folk-Rock Voice of the 1960s Whose Influence Spanned Decades, Dies at 81
results.abstract: He was an original member of the Byrds and a founder of Crosby, Stills & Nash. But he was almost as well known for his troubled personal life as for his music.

media.caption: David Crosby in 1976. He was inducted twice into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, as a founding member of the Byrds and Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young.

results.adx_keywords: Race and Ethnicity;Black People;States (US);Education;Critical Race Theory;DeSantis, Ron;Gates, Henry Louis Jr;College Board;National Review;Florida
results.byline: By Patricia Mazzei and Anemona Hartocollis
results.title: Florida Rejects A.P. African American Studies Class
results.abstract: The state’s Department of Education said in a letter that the course content was “inexplicably contrary to Florida law and significantly lacks educational value.”

media.caption: Last year, Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida signed legislation that restricted how racism and other aspects of history can be taught in schools and workplaces. A federal judge blocked part of the law, but it still applies to public schools.
media.copyright: Daniel A. Varela/Miami Herald, via Associated Press

results.title: George Santos’s Mother Was Not in New York on 9/11, Records Show
results.abstract: Mr. Santos, who has come under intense criticism for fabricating large portions of his life story, had claimed she had been in the South Tower when it was struck.

media.caption: Mr. Santos’s apparent lie about his connection to the attack on the World Trade Center, seen here in 1989, may be particularly upsetting to many New Yorkers.
